00001 /* 
00002  * jcom.cubic_interpolate
00003  * External for Jamoma: cubic interpolation on a stream of floats
00004  * By Trond Lossius, Copyright © 2006
00005  *

00010 #include "Jamoma.h"
00011 
00012 typedef struct _cubic_interp{   // Data structure for this object 
00013         t_object        ob;                             // Must always be the first field; used by Max
00014         void            *obex;
00015         float           value[4];               // Four y values used for interpolation
00016         float           mu;                             // Previous interpolated x-position
00017         float           attr_step;              // ATTRIBUTE: step size 
00018         char            clearflag;
00019         void            *outlet2;               // Pointer to outlet. need one for each outlet
00020         void            *outlet;
00021 } t_cubic_interp;
00022 
00023 // Prototypes for methods: need a method for each incoming message
00024 void *cubic_interpolate_new(t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00025 t_max_err cubic_interpolation_setstep(t_cubic_interp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00026 void cubic_interpolate_bang(t_cubic_interp *x);
00027 void cubic_interpolate_int(t_cubic_interp *x, long n);
00028 void cubic_interpolate_float(t_cubic_interp *x, double f);
00029 void cubic_interpolate_clear(t_cubic_interp *x);
00030 void cubic_interpolate_assist(t_cubic_interp *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);
00031 
00032 
00033 
00034 // Globals
00035 t_class         *this_class;                            // Required. Global pointing to this class 
00036 
00037 
00038 
00039 /************************************************************************************/
00040 // Main() Function
00041 
00042 int main(void)
00043 {       
00044         long attrflags = 0;
00045         t_class *c;
00046         t_object *attr;
00047 
00048         jamoma_init();
00049 
00050         // Define our class
00051         c = class_new("jcom.cubic_interpolate",(method)cubic_interpolate_new, (method)0L, (short)sizeof(t_cubic_interp), 
00052                 (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00053         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_cubic_interp, obex));                              
00054 
00055         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)cubic_interpolate_bang,              "bang",         A_CANT,         0);
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)cubic_interpolate_int,               "int",          A_LONG,         0);
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)cubic_interpolate_float,     "float",        A_FLOAT,        0);
00059         class_addmethod(c, (method)cubic_interpolate_assist,    "assist",       A_CANT,         0);  
00060     class_addmethod(c, (method)cubic_interpolate_clear,         "clear",        0);
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,                 "dumpout",      0);  
00062     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,            "quickref", A_CANT,             0);
00063 
00064         // Add attributes to our class: 
00065         // ATTRIBUTE: step size - clipped to the range [0, 1]
00066         attr = attr_offset_new("step", _sym_float, attrflags,
00067                 (method)0L, (method)cubic_interpolation_setstep, calcoffset(t_cubic_interp, attr_step));
00068         class_addattr(c, attr);
00069         
00070         // Finalize our class
00071         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00072         this_class = c; 
00073         return 0;
00074 }
00075 
00076 
00077 /************************************************************************************/
00078 // Object Life
00079 
00080 void *cubic_interpolate_new(t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00081 {
00082         t_cubic_interp *x;
00083         
00084         x = (t_cubic_interp *)object_alloc(this_class); // create the new instance and return a pointer to it
00085         
00086         if(x){
00087         object_obex_store(x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x,NULL));       // dumpout      
00088                 x->outlet2 = bangout(x);                                        // create 2nd outlet. Used to ask for new value
00089                 x->outlet = floatout(x);                                        // create the outlet
00090                 cubic_interpolate_clear(x);                                     // initilaize instance          
00091                 x->attr_step = 1.;                                                      // default value
00092                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                       // handle attribute args
00093         }
00094         return (x);                                                                             // return the pointer
00095 }
00096 
00097 
00098 /************************************************************************************/
00099 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00100 
00101 
00102 // ATTRIBUTE: step
00103 t_max_err cubic_interpolation_setstep(t_cubic_interp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00104 {
00105         float f;
00106         
00107         f = atom_getfloat(argv);
00108         if (f<0) f = 0;
00109         if (f>1) f = 1;
00110         
00111         x->attr_step = f;
00112         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00113 }
00114 
00115 // BANG input
00116 void cubic_interpolate_bang(t_cubic_interp *x)
00117 {
00118         double y0, y1, y2, y3, mu, mu2;
00119         double a0,a1,a2,a3;
00120         
00121         if (x->clearflag) {
00122                 outlet_bang(x->outlet2);                                        // ask for a new value
00123                 if (x->clearflag) {                                                     // check again
00124                         outlet_float(x->outlet, 0);                             // if we still have not received any points, return 0
00125                         return;
00126                 }       
00127         }       
00128         
00129         if (x->attr_step>1)
00130                 x->attr_step=1;
00131         if (x->attr_step<0.)
00132                 x->attr_step=0;
00133         mu = x->mu + x->attr_step;
00134         if (mu>=1.) {
00135                 outlet_bang(x->outlet2);                                        // ask for a new value
00136                 mu = mu - 1.;
00137         }                       
00138         mu2 = mu*mu;
00139         
00140         y0 = x->value[0];
00141         y1 = x->value[1];
00142         y2 = x->value[2];
00143         y3 = x->value[3];
00144 
00145         a0 = y3 - y2 - y0 + y1;
00146         a1 = y0 - y1 - a0;
00147         a2 = y2 - y0;
00148         a3 = y1;
00149 
00150         outlet_float(x->outlet, a0*mu*mu2+a1*mu2+a2*mu+a3);
00151         x->mu = mu;
00152 }
00153 
00154 
00155 // INT input
00156 void cubic_interpolate_int(t_cubic_interp *x, long n)
00157 {
00158         cubic_interpolate_float(x, (double)n);
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00162 // FLOAT input
00163 void cubic_interpolate_float(t_cubic_interp *x, double f)
00164 {
00165         long i;
00166 
00167         if (x->clearflag) {
00168                 for (i=0; i<4; i++)     
00169                         x->value[i] = f;
00170                 x->clearflag = 0;
00171                 }
00172         else {
00173                 for (i=0; i<3; i++)
00174                         x->value[i] = x->value[i+1];
00175                 x->value[3] = f;
00176         }
00177 }
00178 
00179 
00180 // CLEAR input
00181 void cubic_interpolate_clear(t_cubic_interp *x)
00182 {       
00183         x->mu = 0.;                             
00184         x->clearflag = 1;
00185 }
00186 
00187 
00188 // Method for Assistance Messages
00189 void cubic_interpolate_assist(t_cubic_interp *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)        // Display assistance messages
00190 {
00191         if(msg==1)
00192         { 
00193                 switch(arg)
00194                 {
00195                         case 0: sprintf(dst, "(bang/float) interpolate, set next");
00196                         break;  
00197                 }
00198         }
00199         else if(msg==2)
00200         {
00201                 switch(arg)
00202                 {
00203                                 case 0: sprintf(dst, "(float) interpolated value"); break;
00204                                 case 1: sprintf(dst, "(bang) need new target value"); break;
00205                                 case 2: sprintf(dst, "dumpout"); break;
00206                 }
00207         }
00208 }
